children.text: Your backstory must include the following two things:
1) You have some kind of positive story with
, a noble dwarf who helped you out in some way in the past.
2) A few years ago you enrolled in the
Training Program. Your back story needs to have some kind of motivation that drove that decision.
This module has a slightly different flaw system. During character creation, you are expected to come up with some kind of immediately evident flaw that will inspire prejudice from NPCs.
1) You detract 1 point from an ability score, and add it to another. This re-allocation must make logical sense.
2) Your flaw will inspire some kind of prejudice-based reaction with any npc that you are talking to.
As mentioned, this flaw can be anything - medical, physical, social, etc. However, it needs to be something that manifests visually and be judgable prior to engaging in conversation.
Ability Score: +1 Wisdom (or Intelligence), -1 Strength (or Constitution)
- Older women, as well as younger women with daddy issues might get flirty
- Gentlefolk may be more respectful and considerate
- Warriors and people of power might see you as a frail has-been
- Youths may be dismissive and disrespectful
2) Branded with eunuch a face tattoo.
- Might invoke pity out of someone
- Might have a woman open up more easily because she isn't threatened by you as a man
- Might mocked or dismissed by masculine men
- Might be looked down upon by nobility
3) Indent in head - left hand tremors
- Wealthy folk may interpret your appearance and mannerisms as mentally unstable and treat you as a lunatic
- Warriors and criminals may be provoked by the hand twitching as a sign of wanting to fight.
- Children may find you silly-looking and fun to play with
- Medical folk may find your condition curious, and be more willing to converse with you.
- Inebriated and artistic people may be more welcoming
- Children are more open and at ease at your presence
- Children may find you silly-looking and fun to play with
- May convey disrespect during ceremonious events.
- Children may get scared by your gruff and dangerous appearance
- Warriors may show respect due to battle scar
- Scarred/crippled people may have a sense of solidarity
- Women will be wary and try to avoid/escape interacting
You can also come up with your own flaw, and associated reallocations/interaction effects
Note: During conversation with an NPC, the flaw that takes effect is that of the player who initiated the conversation.
The following are the basic 5e classes - click on the link to view more details:
- Hit Dice: 1d12, Suggested abilities: Strength, Constitution
- Hit Dice: 1d8, Suggested abilities: Charisma, Dexterity
- Hit Dice: 1d8, Suggested abilities: Wisdom, Strength or Constitution
- Hit Dice: 1d8, Suggested abilities: Wisdom, Constitution
- Hit Dice: 1d10, Suggested abilities: Strength or Dexterity, Constitution or Intelligence
- Hit Dice: 1d8, Suggested abilities: Dexterity, Wisdom
- Hit Dice: 1d10, Suggested abilities: Strength, Charisma
- Hit Dice: 1d10, Suggested abilities: Dexterity or Strength, Wisdom
- Hit Dice: 1d8, Suggested abilities: Dexterity, Intelligence or Charisma
- Hit Dice: 1d6, Suggested abilities: Charisma, Constitution
- Hit Dice: 1d8, Suggested abilities: Charisma, Consitution
- Hit Dice: 1d6, Suggested abilities: Intelligence, Constitution or Dexterity or Charisma
In addition to the above, there are some additional ones available via expansions. You can use them if DM feels it's acceptable.
You can select any race from the 5e base edition, no questions asked (open the character link for additional race-specific traits):
- +2 Charisma, +1 your choice of ability, speed 30ft, medium size
- +1 to each ability score, speed 30ft, medium size
You can also explore races from other expansions
, but talk to your DM to confirm that your choice is acceptable to the campaign.
You can select any background from the following list, which includes backgrounds from other sources:
- Skill Proficiencies: Deception (CHA), sleight of hand (DEX)
- Skill Proficiencies: Sleight of hand (DEX), stealth (DEX)
There are also other backgrounds that you can find
Assign your desired ability scores from the following array: 8, 9, 12, 14, 16, 17
Your starting health is as indicated for your
Per level, you roll as indicated for your class. However, if your roll is equal to or lower than your CON modifier, re-roll it.
You come equipped with whatever default equipment comes from your class and background.
Starting Gold is whatever you start with based on your class/background. Add 350 gold, and roll for the following amount depending on your class:
If you go for a class outside of the above options, do the following:
Utility class (alchemist, noble, artisan, etc.): 5d4 x 10gp
Before starting the campaign, go to the
and spend your gold as you see fit. You can also sell any equipment you don't want, for 50% (+10% per charisma modifier) of its market value
